meanings.sent1: I picked a ripe babacus from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The babacus was sweet and juicy.
meanings.sent3: The babacus rolled off the table and made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright and colorful as a babacus.
meanings.sent5: The babacus looked like a small, round rainbow in my hand.

meanings.definition: to play or engage in a childish manner
meanings.sent1: The children decided to babacus in the park all afternoon.
meanings.sent2: He would often babacus with his toys when he was bored.
meanings.sent3: She pretended to babacus with the toy car, making engine noises.
meanings.sent4: Their laughter filled the room as they babacused around.
meanings.sent5: The siblings would babacus together, lost in their own little world.
